intro: Ceuthostoma palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan loach, is a freshwater fish native to the rivers and streams of Palawan, Philippines. It belongs to the family Cobitidae and is characterized by its slender body and distinctive coloration. The plant aspect of this species refers to its habitat in aquatic environments rich in vegetation, where it often shelters among submerged plants. It plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to nutrient cycling and serving as prey for larger predators. Its presence is an indicator of the health and biodiversity of freshwater ecosystems in Palawan.
